reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Women's Farmers' Clubs in Dowa District Malawi Phase II

description.narrative: The project is located in the rural district of Dowa in Central Malawi where the majority of people engage in small scale farming. Challenges such as limited access to land capital credit facilities and reliable markets are major impediments to economic pr ogress especially for women.The project is a continuation to Dowa Women Farmers? Club project implemented during 2012-2014. The overall objective is to reduce poverty and promote gender equality in the households of 3500 women farmers in Dowa. The project will consolidate the knowledge and skills that 2750 female farmers gained during phase 1 of the project and include 750 new farmers. The project will have a strong emphasis on agribusiness. The elements of processing marketing and packaging at the 2 produc tion centres established during phase 1 will play an important role. The farmers will also be trained in producing certified seeds and get registered with the certifying body. The 2 cooperatives established during phase 1 will be strengthened by training t he women farmers on their roles and responsibilities as members of a cooperative as well as its function management and operations to all members? benefit. Parallel to this the project will mobilise 750 new women farmers organise them in Farmers Clubs and train them in areas such as conservation farming crop diversification agroforestry small scale irrigation animal husbandry marketing and micro financing.All 3500 farmers and project staff will be trained in the rights of women and people with disabilities. Among the new 750 new members the project will aim to include 75 women with disabilities.The project will benefit the farmers and their families approximately 19250 people as well as 17500 community members who will be invited to participate open days and crop demonstrations and learn about gender issues and HIV/AIDS.
